query.queryString: (/article/relations/categories/collection/code='resultsPack,projectsInfoPack,brief' OR (/result/relations/categories/collection/code='deliverable,publication' OR contenttype='project')) AND ('SUSTAINABILITY' OR 'INNOVATION' OR 'MULTI-CRITERIA')

warnings.message: One of the fields on which a sort was requested does not exist

result.title: 6 National reports on educational community members and school system
result.description: The reports will highlight the relationship between members of the educational community and migrant children, gaps in their knowledge, their perceptions, approach towards the integration of migrant children. Reports will also refer to principles of child-cantered education in managing diversity and to practices applied to promote cultural diversity in schools.

result.title: Political and media discourse analysis and review of public opinion: 6 national reports
result.description: Political and media discourse analysis and review of public opinion reports will give an overview of the stereotypes, narratives and attitudes of political, media and general public discourses in relation to migrant integration issues.

result.title: Report on EU Policy
result.description: The report will include in-depth examination of policy instruments and legal regulations will be conducted to assess integration policies across study regions, and activities undertaken by European and national agencies in the field of migration/integration in schools through policy analysis and case studies. It will also focus on review of ‘grey’ literature – that is, policy documents using both on- and off-line methods – to assess the current knowledge base on migrant children’s integration.

result.description: State of the art national reports will present the structure of migrant communities in receiving countries, including existing datasets, statistics and other quantitative data; review of integration policies, initiatives and best practices on a national level.

result.title: Report on child-centred approach across disciplines
result.description: Report on child-centred approach across disciplines will, corresponding to the project’s principal focus, provide thorough analysis of the ontologies of the child-centred approach across disciplines. It will also provide an account of the state of the art of methodologies applied with children and especially vulnerable and migrant children, as well as the methodologies used and developed within the child-centred approach.

result.title: General cross-disciplinary report on preliminary results of research relating to scientific literature and data sets overview
result.description: General cross-disciplinary report on preliminary results of research relating to scientific literature and data sets overview will provide in-depth overview of the general theoretical work conducted in the fields of sociology, anthropology, pedagogics, law, philosophy and (social) policy studies regarding the integration of migrant children in schools and of the methodological approaches used in empirical studies carried out in this field.

result.title: Performance Monitoring Report of Cities
result.description: The Performance Monitoring Report of Cities will outline indicators, benchmarks and monitoring results of the matching of cities and powerhouse projects performed in cooperation between cities with similar characteristics in Europe and in China. The report will also include recommendations for improved cooperation and more effective measures, based on the monitoring results. This deliverable is led by CIUC and AIT.

result.title: Impact Assessment Report (no. 2)
result.description: The Impact Assessment Reports will outline the short- and mid-term impacts of the most important URBAN-EU-CHINA Platform Activities, including the challenges and stakeholders they are intended to address, and potentially unintended side effects. Where possible, potential long-term effects will be indicated. The impact assessment will be performed with a variety of tools and methodologies, including quantitative and qualitative data, secondary data analysis, semi-structured interviews and surveys, stakeholder participation, and input from monitoring of cities. The Impact Assessment Reports will analyse the intensity and direction of impacts, identify synergies, conflicts and trade-offs, and propose corrective measures, using actor analysis. The Impact Assessment Reports will allow for fine-tuned planning of future events and inform the update the Strategic R&I Agenda. This deliverable is led by IOER and CIUC, with contributions from ISIS and CAUPD.
